abstract: Expectations among investors and others are high for change under Xi Jinping, but he appears to be facing his first major test with the public blowup over the censoring of the liberal newspaper Southern Weekend.
snippet: Expectations among investors and others are high for change under Xi Jinping, but he appears to be facing his first major test with the public blowup over the censoring of the liberal newspaper Southern Weekend.
lead_paragraph: The Shanghai stock market is officially in bull territory, having climbed just over 20 percent since early December. Economists’ forecasts for 2013 economic growth are for the most part cautiously positive, though heavy with caveats about calls for economic reforms.

headline.main: A Bull in Stocks, but a Bear for Free Speech

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
